sn22.52:4.2: “Mendicants, focus on the source of form. Truly see the impermanence of form.
sn22.52:4.3: When a mendicant does this, they become disillusioned with form.
sn22.52:4.4: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn22.52:4.5: When relishing and greed end, the mind is freed, and is said to be well freed.
sn22.52:4.6: Focus on the source of feeling …
sn22.52:4.15: consciousness. Truly see the impermanence of consciousness.
sn22.52:4.16: When a mendicant does this, they become disillusioned with consciousness.
sn22.52:4.17: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn22.52:4.18: When relishing and greed end, the mind is freed, and is said to be well freed.”
